channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: 96 new cases among Filipinos abroad bring total to 12,446
item.description: DFA in its daily bulletin did not identify where the new cases originated, but attributed the spike from late reports of only a lone country in Europe.

item.title: Don't forget health protocols, faithful told as Simbang Gabi begins
item.author: Christian Deiparine
item.description: "We cannot overemphasize the need to follow the minimum health protocols at all times," the DOH said in a statement. "Gatherings like Simbang Gabi can easily become superspreader events."

item.title: Taliptip fishers, groups file writ of kalikasan vs Bulacan airport project
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Former residents of Barangay Taliptip in Bulakan town, Oceana Philippines and two other petitioners urged the Supreme Court to issue a writ of kalikasan against the San Miguel airport project in Bulacan.

item.title: Senate bill seeks regulation of vape products
item.description: Under Senate Bill No. 1951, "the government shall regulate the importation, manufacture, sale, packaging, distribution, use, advertisement, promotion and sponsorship of Vaporized Nicotine Products."

item.title: Palace insists 'no favorites' on vaccine purchase from drugmakers
item.author: Christian Deiparine
item.description: Concerns had been raised that government is seemingly opting for the said vaccines — targeting 25 million doses — when it has yet to prove its efficacy and is actually the second most expensive among those being eyed for procurement.

item.title: Duterte orders PhilHealth to simplify payment claims process
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte has ordered the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. to simplify the payment claims process in the wake of reports about delayed payments in hospitals.

item.title: Senate bill sponsored by Marcos would see return to ‘fraud-prone’ polls — election lawyer
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: An election lawyer on Monday warned against a bill at the Senate, sponsored by Sen. Imee Marcos, proposing a "hybrid" election system which would involve manual vote counting at the precinct level.

item.title: Palace: Probe into 'drug war' useless since Philippines rejects ICC jurisdiction
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Presidential spokesperson Harry Roque, a human rights lawyer years ago, said the lack of cooperation by the Philippines means that pursuing an investigation would be a waste of the court’s resources and time.

item.title: 1,135 new cases push Philippines’ COVID-19 tally to over 451,839
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Active cases in the Philippines stood at 24,160 or 5.3% of the total recorded infections.

item.title: Pilot run for in-person learning set on Jan. 11 with smaller class size, reduced hours
item.author: Christian Deiparine
item.description: Government on Tuesday said the pilot run for resuming face-to-face classes will begin by January 11, which will take place in areas under modified general community quarantine and follow reduced schedules and limited class sizes.
